summary: With the current craze about micro-services I spend a considerable amount of time dealing with Rest API's. They mostly send and receive data in JSON format. That is where Jackson comes in handy. In this article I'll show some code examples of some non trivial use cases of Jackson I came across.
title: Effective Jackson with annotations in Spring Boot
